intro: Braya purpurascens f. leiocarpa, commonly known as the smoothleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. This variety is distinguished by its smooth, hairless leaves, which set it apart from other forms of Braya purpurascens.
